text: __NOTOC__ The Most Exalted Order of the White Elephant (; ) is an order of Thailand. It was established in 1861 by King Rama IV of the Kingdom of Siam. Along with the Order of the Crown of Thailand, it is regularly awarded to any government official for services rendered to Thailand for five years, making it Thailand's most-commonly awarded order.Regulation of the Office of the Prime Minister regarding nominations for the Most Exalted Order of the White Elephant and the Most Noble Order of the Crown of Thailand, B.E. 2536. Royal Thai Government Gazette. 1993. ==Classes== The order consists of eight classes: {|class="wikitable" width="70%" |- ! width="10%" | Ribbon || width="20%"| Class || width="20%"| Name || width="5%" | Postnominals ||width="10%"| Former Nameราชกิจจานุเบกษา, พระราชบัญญัติเครื่องราชอิสริยาภรณ์ช้างเผือก รัตนโกสินทร์ ศก๑๒๘, เล่ม ๒๖, ตอน ๐ ก, ๒๘ พฤศจิกายน พ.ศ. ๒๔๕๒, หน้า ๗๐ ||width="15%"| Established Date || width="10%"| Order of precedenceราชกิจจานุเบกษา, ประกาศสำนักนายกรัฐมนตรี เรื่อง ลำดับเกียรติเครื่องราชอิสริยาภรณ์ไทย, เล่ม ๑๑๐, ตอน ๒๙ง ฉบับพิเศษ, ๑๒ มีนาคม พ.ศ. ๒๕๓๖, หน้า ๑ |- | center || Knight Grand Cordon (Special Class) || มหาปรมาภรณ์ช้างเผือก (Maha Paramaphon Chang Phueak) || KGE || - || 16 November 1909 || 8 |- | center || Knight Grand Cross (First Class) || ประถมาภรณ์ช้างเผือก (Prathamaphon Chang Phueak) || GCE || มหาวราภรณ์ Maha Varabhorn|| 1869 || 10 |- | center || Knight Commander (Second Class) || ทวีติยาภรณ์ช้างเผือก (Thawitiyaphon Chang Phueak) || KCE || จุลวราภรณ์ Chula Varabhorn|| 1869 || 15 |- | center || Commander (Third Class) || ตริตาภรณ์ช้างเผือก (Tritaphon Chang Phueak) || CE || นิภาภรณ์ Nibhabhorn|| 1869 || 23 |- | center || Companion (Fourth Class) || จัตุรถาภรณ์ช้างเผือก (Chatturathaphon Chang Phueak) || OE || ภูษนาภรณ์ Bhusanabhorn|| 1869 || 28 |- | center || Member (Fifth Class) || เบญจมาภรณ์ช้างเผือก (Benchamphon Chang Phueak) || ME || ทิพยาภรณ์ Dibyabhorn|| 1873 || 33 |- | center || Gold Medal (Sixth Class) || เหรียญทองช้างเผือก (Rian Thong Chang Phueak) || G.M.E || - || 20 July 1902 || 52 |- | center || Silver Medal (Seventh Class) || เหรียญเงินช้างเผือก (Rian Ngoen Chang Phueak) || S.M.E || - || 20 July 1902 || 55 |} ==Gallery== ===Old designs=== File:Woodcraving of the Order of the White Elephant,1st Class (Maha Varabhorn), Wat Ratchabophit.jpg|A woodcarving of "Maha Varabhorn", the Knight Grand Cross (First Class) of the Order of the White Elephant, version that used from 1869-1909, at gates of Phra Vihara of Wat Ratchabophit Sathit Maha Simaram, Bangkok. 7th Class (Silver Medal) - male.jpg|Silver Medal (7th Class) of Order of the White Elephant ==Selected recipients== Certificate for the Commander of Order of the White Elephant, given to Professor Galileo Chini by King Vajiravudh of Siam in 14 August 1913. * Emperor Napoleon III - Knight Grand Cross (1851, Custom Design) * Be Biauw Tjoan, Majoor-titulair der Chinezen – Knight (1895) *Plaek Phibunsongkhram - Knight Grand Cordon * Sultan Ibrahim of Johor - Knight Grand Cordon * Sultan Abdul Hamid Halim Shah of Kedah - Knight Grand Cordon * Chavalit Yongchaiyudh - Knight Grand Cordon * Alexander I of Yugoslavia - Knight Grand Cordon * Bob Hawke - Knight Grand Cordon * Albert du Roy de Blicquy * Norodom of Cambodia - Knight Grand Cross * John T. Cole - Knight Commander * Pakubuwono X - Knight Grand Cross (1929) * Miklós Horthy - Knight Grand Cross * The Earl Mountbatten of Burma - Knight Grand Cross * Foster C. LaHue * Sir Samuel Robinson, 1923. "Capt. Samuel Robinson, Who Won Fame For Rescue Work in Jap Quake, Dies," New York Times. September 7, 1958. * Graves B. Erskine - Knight Grand Cross * Arne Skaug. * Pierra Vejjabul *Joseph J. Cappucci - Knight Commander (Second Class) *David John Collins Awarded by King Rama V in 1897 (Fourth Class) *Frederick William Verney - Commander *Queen Victoria *General William Westmoreland - Knight Grand Cross *Vice Admiral Józef Unrug *Major General Richard Secord * Jiri Sitler - Knight Grand Cross (2006)Jiri Sitler * Lieutenant Commander Saman Kunan - Knight Grand Cross (2018) ==See also== * ==References== ==External links== * The Most Exalted Order of the White Elephant, Secretariat to the Cabinet of Thailand White Elephant, Order Of The White Elephant, Order Of The White Elephant, Order Of The Category:1861 establishments in Siam
